execution_summary: I ran the translated Python replication (Hossain_Replication__py.py) on the provided cross-country replication dataset. Key steps: generated Dockerfile and image, started container, iteratively debugged the Python entrypoint to handle an older Stata file format (pandas could not read the Stata version 110), installed/used pyreadstat to read the .dta file, and handled a numpy compatibility issue by ensuring a compatible numpy and patching missing numpy aliases at runtime. After these fixes the OLS regression cases_per_million ~ democracy + temperature + openness executed successfully on N=150 countries. The main focal hypothesis (positive association between democracy and COVID cases per million) was tested; the democracy coefficient is positive and statistically significant. All code changes were limited to the Python translation to make it runnable in the container (original Stata .do left unchanged).

code_executed.command: Generated Dockerfile and built image (orchestrator_generate_dockerfile & orchestrator_build_image)
code_executed.logs: Dockerfile generated from replication_info.json and image replication_image:latest built successfully.
code_executed.environment: Docker: python:3.10-slim base image; intended Python packages: pandas, numpy, statsmodels, pyreadstat (image build step included pip installs).

code_executed.logs: Initial failures and fixes: (1) pandas.read_stata raised ValueError: Stata file version 110 unsupported by pandas; (2) pyreadstat was not available in the running container; the script installed pyreadstat (and numpy==1.23.5) at runtime; (3) pyreadstat initially failed to import due to numpy alias removal (np.float); this was resolved by setting legacy aliases and ensuring numpy compatibility in the script before importing pyreadstat. After these fixes the script read the .dta using pyreadstat, preprocessed variables, and ran OLS. Final run completed successfully and wrote outputs to replication_data/Hossain_Replication_results.txt and replication_data/Hossain_Replication_coefs.json.
code_executed.environment: Runtime within container: Python 3.10. pandas available in image (pandas 2.3.3), statsmodels installed (>=0.13), numpy provided by image but patched/adjusted at runtime; the script installed numpy==1.23.5 in user site and pyreadstat==1.1.4 to read the older Stata file. Final effective environment: Python 3.10 with pandas 2.3.3, numpy 1.23.5 (user-installed), statsmodels, pyreadstat 1.1.4.

results.hypothesis_tested: Primary hypothesis: At the country level, the democracy index is positively associated with confirmed COVID-19 cases per one million people (cases_per_million on 2020-04-03 regressed on democracy, controlling for average yearly temperature and economic openness).

findings_summary.effect_size: Partial: adjusted R-squared for model = 0.3468 (see below).

tables.table_description: OLS regression summary text produced by statsmodels for the model cases_per_million ~ democracy + temperature + openness.
JSON file containing parameter estimates, p-values, nobs, and adjusted R-squared.
